intro: Gynandriris propinqua, commonly known as the slender spurge. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Gynandriris propinqua is often found in the southeastern United States, where it thrives in humid climates.
